column4: Regular debian seems to use runlevels for gui/nongui (cmdline/x), but ubuntu apparently doesn't.
So if I need to add a script so that my cardbus network card gets ifup'ed, where would I put it?
specifically, you need a pre hook.
A pre hook like pre-up? The problem is that it's never set as "up" ...
what's the usb device id for your scanner?
I tihnk there used to be a udev rule, but grep 011b /etc/udev/rules.d/* doesn't find anything
ok, that would be due to a change in the sane-backends source package.  The udev rules are no longer installed due to hal providing that info.
hal doesn't seem to be doing it (I'm actually running hal right now, on this machine, though I usually disable it)
so if your scanner is not working, please file a bug against the hal-info source package.
Okay, will do (and for myself I guess I'll go copy my udev settings from gutsy, 'cause I'd rather have udev handling it anyway)
